From: @Lahiru Rajapakshe 

Subject: Phrase 1

Date: 11/07/2025



Overview

The CeedPods API provides a comprehensive RESTful interface for managing leads, deals, and products in the CeedPods CRM system. This documentation covers all available endpoints, request/response formats, and authentication requirements.

Base URL: https://ceedpodservice.wittycliff-5b88c7b4.westus2.azurecontainerapps.io/api/v1

Alternative Base URL : https://api.teamhandle.com/api/v1

Authentication

All API requests require Bearer token authentication. Include the authorization token in the request header:

Authorization: Bearer {your_token}

Token Format: JWT (JSON Web Token)
Token Location: Request Header
Authentication Realm: ceedpods-keycloak

API Endpoints

Leads Management

Create Lead

Creates a new lead in the system.

Endpoint: POST /api/leads

Headers:

Content-Type: application/json

Authorization: Bearer {token}

Request Body:

json

{
  "originatedFrom": "facebook",
  "leadName": "John Doe - Tech Solutions",
  "company": "Tech Solutions Inc",
  "companyAddress": "123 Tech Street, Silicon Valley, CA 94025",
  "companyWebsite": "https://techsolutions.example.com",
  "communication": [
    {"phone": "987987987"},
    {"email": "john.doe@techsolutions.com"}
  ],
  "platform": "Enterprise",
  "contactNumber": "987987987",
  "dealId": "4c144ac6-9eb1-410d-9b3c-f5853930bbd2"
}

Field Descriptions:

originatedFrom (string): Source channel where the lead originated

leadName (string): Full name and description of the lead

company (string): Company name

companyAddress (string): Physical address of the company

companyWebsite (string): Company website URL

communication (array): Array of contact methods (phone/email)

platform (string): Platform type

contactNumber (string): Primary contact number

dealId (string): UUID of associated deal (optional)

cURL Example:

bash

curl --location 'https://ceedpodservice.wittycliff-5b88c7b4.westus2.azurecontainerapps.io/api/v1/api/leads' \
--header 'Content-Type: application/json' \
--header 'Authorization: Bearer eyJhbGciOiJSUzI1NiIsInR5cCIgOiAiSldUIiwia2lkIiA6ICIwckx0UTdKN3RzZ3hBMG1PdG1jVUxDWGItSmRURVdBakc1YXkwQjFGQmdjIn0..EWRBO9HGPfIeJ2LKPFGVzQYwH-tRwjKkMkBRBbaRkTDEoU9oRo7caTVysHLDk3xs1G9vrgOkqh6xGIh3vGLLlUBc58Rer2LLSRZZ_71Hr0Jv7bLYqZemXKMxAeMH_0bxnY6DxkybfeRvuoXyN8_Tnp4USIrMyJS_9bJssFX4zGMxsG_uQ0Svm_AJWNnfURgFirlrQjNwnqkWhvy0nGUDlh3miks9hZODXj5olcuXBWFpxiDwj3I65RqA-nB4c7Fd-UoAjPE_pu4dIXKC3QY2wiwRL31AxNXZY8JgdELqUoFM4F2N1_8sFrWkKA5s5MTWBseFktzjnkjGtHQ21trzTA' \
--data-raw '{
      "originatedFrom": "facebook",
      "leadName": "John Doe - Tech Solutions6-up-2",
      "company": "Tech Solutions Inc",
      "companyAddress": "123 Tech Street, Silicon Valley, CA 94025",
      "companyWebsite": "https://techsolutions.example.com",
      "communication": [
        {"phone": "987987987"},
        {"email": "john.doe@techsolutions.com"}
      ],
      "platform": "Enterprise",
      "contactNumber": "987987987",
      "dealId": "4c144ac6-9eb1-410d-9b3c-f5853930bbd2"
    }'

Response: Returns the created lead object with generated ID

Deals Management

Create Deal

Creates a new deal in the system.

Endpoint: POST /deals

Headers:

Content-Type: application/json

Authorization: Bearer {token}

Request Body:

json

{
  "dealName": "Enterprise Software Deal",
  "productIds": ["6905837cb6819009a16e97ec"],
  "salesReps": ["7f3e18ab-3827-41df-89d7-e65da14505ef"],
  "leadId": ""
}

Field Descriptions:

dealName (string): Name/title of the deal

productIds (array): Array of product MongoDB ObjectIds associated with the deal

salesReps (array): Array of sales representative UUIDs

leadId (string): UUID of associated lead (optional)

cURL Example:

bash

curl --location 'https://ceedpodservice.wittycliff-5b88c7b4.westus2.azurecontainerapps.io/api/v1/deals' \
--header 'Content-Type: application/json' \
--header 'Authorization: Bearer eyJhbGciOiJSUzI1NiIsInR5cCIgOiAiSldUIiwia2lkIiA6ICIwckx0UTdKN3RzZ3hBMG1PdG1jVUxDWGItSmRURVdBakc1YXkwQjFGQmdjIn0..EWRBO9HGPfIeJ2LKPFGVzQYwH-tRwjKkMkBRBbaRkTDEoU9oRo7caTVysHLDk3xs1G9vrgOkqh6xGIh3vGLLlUBc58Rer2LLSRZZ_71Hr0Jv7bLYqZemXKMxAeMH_0bxnY6DxkybfeRvuoXyN8_Tnp4USIrMyJS_9bJssFX4zGMxsG_uQ0Svm_AJWNnfURgFirlrQjNwnqkWhvy0nGUDlh3miks9hZODXj5olcuXBWFpxiDwj3I65RqA-nB4c7Fd-UoAjPE_pu4dIXKC3QY2wiwRL31AxNXZY8JgdELqUoFM4F2N1_8sFrWkKA5s5MTWBseFktzjnkjGtHQ21trzTA' \
--data '{
      "dealName": "Enterprise Software Deal31",
      "productIds": ["6905837cb6819009a16e97ec"],
      "salesReps": ["7f3e18ab-3827-41df-89d7-e65da14505ef"],

Response: Returns the created deal object with generated ID

Products Management

Note: Product endpoints use a different base URL: https://api.teamhandle.com/api/v1

Create Product

Creates a new product in the system.

Endpoint: POST /api/products

Headers:

Content-Type: application/json

Authorization: Bearer {token}

Request Body:

json

{
  "productId": "PRD-006",
  "productName": "Test Product",
  "productValue": 100.00,
  "productDescription": "Product description",
  "productSubDescription": "Product sub-description",
  "productStatus": "Active"
}

Field Descriptions:

productId (string): Unique product identifier

productName (string): Name of the product

productValue (number): Monetary value of the product

productDescription (string): Main product description

productSubDescription (string): Additional product details

productStatus (string): Product status (e.g., "Active", "Inactive")

cURL Example:

bash

curl --location 'https://api.teamhandle.com/api/v1/api/products' \
--header 'Content-Type: application/json' \
--header 'Authorization: Bearer eyJhbGciOiJSUzI1NiIsInR5cCIgOiAiSldUIiwia2lkIiA6ICIwckx0UTdKN3RzZ3hBMG1PdG1jVUxDWGItSmRURVdBakc1YXkwQjFGQmdjIn0..j-40vkCgtsvVwZEy0r6IK8RHTedwLo_GHEd0v5bH7seuKn4FjF26p-yQYT8-d-vgMKsqlhfBTThziXNkMP_yQYsHw0sAr0QilFY1YFth_OVt9pA0s1GbfEwlzyGAnYZs0qbzUpLZxekI8w7PRbfuoCvj05wuyJock0Hh5WLu5gVtgLghij6ixhfjThrriNRAsTh_TdMIYDQWAr5X7Kz9MgMYQ3U4cIaLhRQEIluy56ZE5iwxi-ZrS1RXHFmPYq43gk-ZEkI12zgh_3KN9FR6U1e-ZEPUUHELlse3-a2UYJ0fSJhuc7hIMxTpfIIh7Rxj3Su3P-6oqvV0rky8hviSpg' \
--data '{
      "productId": "PRD-006",
      "productName": "Test Produc2",
      "productValue": 100.00,
      "productDescription":"ooo",
      "productSubDescription":"rrr sub",
      "productStatus":"Active"
  }'

Response: Returns the created product object with MongoDB ObjectId

Retrieves a specific product by its unique identifier.

Path Parameters:

Headers:

Authorization: Bearer {token}

bash

Update Product

Updates an existing product's information.

Endpoint: PUT /products/{productId}

Path Parameters:

productId (string): MongoDB ObjectId of the product to update

Headers:

Content-Type: application/json

Authorization: Bearer {token}

Request Body:

json

{
  "productName": "Updated Product Name"
}

Note: Partial updates are supported. Only include fields that need to be updated.

cURL Example:

bash

Search Products

Searches for products based on a query string.

Endpoint: GET /products/search?query={searchTerm}

Query Parameters:

query (string): Search term to match against product fields

Headers:

Authorization: Bearer {token}

cURL Example:

bash
